title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrew Brown. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brown (2024). rjackcess: Interface Jackcess, Java library reading writing MS Access databases. R package version 0.2.0, http://humus.rocks/rjackcess/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rjackcess: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases},   author = {Andrew Brown},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {http://humus.rocks/rjackcess/}, }

what: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases
title: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases
text: rjackcess uses {rJava} provide basic interface Jackcess https://jackcess.sourceforge.io/ Java API MS Access databases. information API available Javadocs (https://javadoc.io/doc/com.healthmarketscience.jackcess/jackcess/latest/index.html).

title: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases
text: can install development version rjackcess like :

title: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases
text: basic example showing create Database instance file, call methods associated object instance, export data flat files, import data back MS Access database.
code: library(rjackcess)  db <- Database("~/pedon/pedon.accdb")  db$getTableNames()  db$getTable('area')  exportAll(db, "~/pedon/output/") importFile("~/pedon/output/pedon.csv", db, "pedon", useExistingTable = TRUE)

what: Initialize a Jackcess Database object instance for interacting with MS Access database files — Database
title: Initialize a Jackcess Database object instance for interacting with MS Access database files — Database
text: Initialize Jackcess Database object instance interacting MS Access database files

title: Initialize a Jackcess Database object instance for interacting with MS Access database files — Database
code: Database(   dsn,   read_only = FALSE,   file_format = c("V2019", "V2016", "V2010", "V2007", "V2003", "V2000", "V1997",     "MSISAM", "GENERIC_JET4"),   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Initialize a Jackcess Database object instance for interacting with MS Access database files — Database
text: dsn character. MS Access database source name (file path). read_only logical Open connection read-? Default FALSE file_format character. One following: "GENERIC_JET4", "MSISAM", "V1997", "V2000", "V2003", "V2007", "V2010", "V2016", "V2019". See details. overwrite logical. overwrite existing file? Default FALSE

title: Initialize a Jackcess Database object instance for interacting with MS Access database files — Database
text: com.healthmarketscience.jackcess.Database object

title: Initialize a Jackcess Database object instance for interacting with MS Access database files — Database
text: "GENERIC_JET4" - database likely created programmatically "MSISAM" - database created MS Money "V1997" - database created MS Access 97 "V2000" - database created MS Access 2000 "V2003" - database created MS Access 2002/2003 "V2007" - database created MS Access 2007 "V2010" - database created MS Access 2010+ "V2016" - database created MS Access 2016+ "V2019" - database created MS Access 2019+ (Office 365)

title: SimpleExportFilter — SimpleExportFilter
text: SimpleExportFilter

title: SimpleExportFilter — SimpleExportFilter
text: com.healthmarketscience.jackcess.util.SimpleImportFilter object

title: SimpleImportFilter — SimpleImportFilter
text: SimpleImportFilter

title: SimpleImportFilter — SimpleImportFilter
text: com.healthmarketscience.jackcess.util.SimpleImportFilter object

what: Export contents of a MS Access Database to Flat Files — exportAll
title: Export contents of a MS Access Database to Flat Files — exportAll
text: Export contents MS Access Database Flat Files

title: Export contents of a MS Access Database to Flat Files — exportAll
code: exportAll(   db,   outdir,   extension = "csv",   header = TRUE,   delim = ",",   quote = "\"",   filter = SimpleExportFilter()$INSTANCE,   ... )

title: Export contents of a MS Access Database to Flat Files — exportAll
text: db  com.healthmarketscience.jackcess.Database object character path MS Access Database. outdir Directory path output files. extension Output file extension. Default: "csv". header Include column names header? Default: TRUE. delim Output file delimiter. Default: "," quote Output file quote character. Default: '"' filter Export filter. Default: SimpleExportFilter()$INSTANCE ... Additional arguments passed Database() db file path.

title: Get Column Metadata — getColumnMetadata
text: Get information columns specified table(s).

title: Get Column Metadata — getColumnMetadata
text: db com.healthmarketscience.jackcess.Database object (e.g. created Database()) table_names character. Database table name. Default NULL return metadata tables db.

title: Get Column Metadata — getColumnMetadata
text: data.frame containing database name (database_name; character), table name (table_name; character), column name (column_name; character), column data type (datatype; character), column length (length; integer), column length units (lengthinunits; integer), column precision (precision; integer), column scale (scale; integer), column SQL type (sqltype; integer), column "append ? (appendonly; logical), column "autonumber?" (autonumber; logical), column "calculated?" (calculated; logical), column "compressed unicode?" (compressedunicode; logical), column "hyperlink?" (hyperlink; logical), column "variable length?" (variablelength; logical)

what: Get Names of Tables in Database — getTableNames
title: Get Names of Tables in Database — getTableNames
text: Get character vector table names specified database.

title: Get Names of Tables in Database — getTableNames
Get Names of Tables in Database — getTableNames
text: db com.healthmarketscience.jackcess.Database object (e.g. created Database())

title: Get Names of Tables in Database — getTableNames
text: character

what: Import a delimited flat file into a new or existing MS Access Database table — importFile
title: Import a delimited flat file into a new or existing MS Access Database table — importFile
text: Import delimited flat file new existing MS Access Database table

title: Import a delimited flat file into a new or existing MS Access Database table — importFile
code: importFile(   dsn,   db,   name,   delim = ",",   quote = "\"",   filter = SimpleImportFilter()$INSTANCE,   useExistingTable = FALSE,   header = TRUE )

title: Import a delimited flat file into a new or existing MS Access Database table — importFile
text: dsn Input file path db Database object name Table name delim Delimiter (default (,)) quote Quote character (default ") filter Optional custom ImportFilter object useExistingTable logical. Use existing tables? Default: FALSE header logical. Input file contains headers? Default: TRUE

what: rjackcess: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases — rjackcess-package
title: rjackcess: Interface to Jackcess, a Java library for reading from and writing to MS Access databases — rjackcess-package
text: rjackcess uses rJava provide basic interface Jackcess https://jackcess.sourceforge.io/ Java API MS Access databases. information API available Javadocs (https://javadoc.io/doc/com.healthmarketscience.jackcess/jackcess/latest/index.html).

title: rjackcess 0.2.0
text: Added constructor SimpleExportFilter() Added getTableNames() getColumnMetadata() methods allowing additional information contents database easily determined Breaking change: dsn argument exportAll() renamed outdir db argument can now accept file path MS Access Database construct Database object Database(). Additional options constructing database instance can passed via .... Update importFile(): quote argument now converted Java character primitive internally.

title: rjackcess 0.1.0
text: Added constructors key Jackcess classes (Database() SimpleImportFilter()) Added exportAll() importFile() methods allowing dumping tables data base flat file, importing flat files new/existing tables Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
